article: Paper was first _ about 2,000 years ago, it has been made _ silk, cotton, bamboo, and wood. People learned to write words on paper to make a book. And because there weren't many books, few people learned to read. Then printing was invented in China. The first printed books were made by _ ink on a wooden block and holding the paper against it. When printing was developed greatly _ the beginning of the 11th century, books could be produced more quickly and _ .  As a result , more people learned to read. After that, knowledge and ideas spread quickly, _ a way that can be compared _ the _ of the Internet in the 20th century.
